messages.content: What does the Seed node in ComfyUI-mxToolkit allow?

The Seed node allows randomizing the seed parameter before generation starts, preserving it for subsequent copying or reapplication. It retains memory of the 2 previous values. The node has the option to enable or disable automatic generation startup, as well as to interrupt the current generation when starting the next. If you press the randomization button while holding the shift key, the seed value will increase by one.
What is the purpose of the 'decimals' parameter in the Slider node?

The 'decimals' parameter in the Slider node controls whether the output is an integer (INT) or a floating-point number (FLOAT). If 'decimals' is zero, the output is an INT variable. Otherwise, the output is a FLOAT variable.
How does the mxReroute node in ComfyUI-mxToolkit work?

The mxReroute node is an alternative version of the standard Reroute node. It takes an input direction and outputs data accordingly. The direction can be set using LEFT, RIGHT, DOWN, UP, or TOP. Shortened versions like L, R, D, U, and T are also accepted.
How does the Stop node function in ComfyUI-mxToolkit?

The Stop node interrupts the generation process, passing input data to the output. However, the generation can be resumed from the interruption point by pressing the Continue button on the node or using the Queue button.
What is the purpose of the 'snap' parameter in the Slider2D node?
The 'snap' parameter in the Slider2D node controls whether snapping occurs according to the set 'step' parameter. It toggles the snapping feature on and off.
What does the Seed (v0.9.0) node in ComfyUI-mxToolkit allow?

The Seed (v0.9.0) node allows randomizing the seed parameter before generation starts, preserving it for subsequent copying or reapplication. It retains memory of the 2 previous values. The node has the option to enable or disable automatic generation startup, as well as to interrupt the current generation when starting the next. If you press the randomization button while holding the shift key, the seed value will increase by one.
How does the mxReroute (v0.9.2) node function in ComfyUI-mxToolkit?

The mxReroute (v0.9.2) node is an alternative version of the standard Reroute node. It takes an input direction and outputs data accordingly. The direction can be set using LEFT, RIGHT, DOWN, UP, or TOP. Shortened versions like L, R, D, U, and T are also accepted.
